div.p:
You do me too much honour in supposing me so deeply and personally interested in the republication of the novels in question - Not so the rest of your letter which gives me the agreeable assurance that you & the young ladies your sisters are to visit Scotland early in May & will honor Abbotsford (never more honored) in the first weeks of that month. Remember however this is only your first visit otherwise we shall be strangely defrauded as I must be in Edinburgh on the 12[th. when our Courts resume their sittings So I know if we can combine to when Abbots of You will find me like a King (every busied with pulling down & building up - there is however enough of lodging such as it is having an actual roof on it for I had the sense to build half of my
house before I pulled the rest down so we shall be well enough though amid lime and dust & good here. Lady Scott thof M of unknown offers her kind respects and I am glad I shall have my daughter Sophia with me who as well as her younger sister & brothers is very eager to make your acquaintance They are neither of them at all made up or got up and rather under than over educated I was so terrified for their becoming lionesses at second hand that I left them in a good measure to their natural gifts - Both are naturally shrewd & sensible & the elder has a sort of quiet and sincere enthusiasm about her own country which will entertain you Always with the greatest truth & respect
trust me with -ford tolerably agreeble the you there again when the autumn vacation sits on me and freedom for four months after 12 July 1822
